intro: Pilosella densiflora, commonly known as denseflower pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Pilosella densiflora typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its fibrous, evergreen foliage and compact growth habit make it a hardy and resilient species.
